alert.note: Alert for Coastal Harris; Fort Bend; Inland Harris; Northern Liberty; Southern Liberty; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 19 at 7:43PM CDT until August 20 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT SUNDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM TO 9 PM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 106. For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with high temperatures from 104 to 106. * WHERE...Northern Liberty, Inland Harris, Wharton, Fort Bend, Southern Liberty and Coastal Harris Counties. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, until 8 AM CDT Sunday. For the Excessive Heat Warning, from 8 AM to 9 PM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
